title: Academic Research Grant Reviewer Workload Balancer
description: A single-page tool for academic research grant panel chairs to upload proposals and reviewer data, detect conflicts of interest, and generate optimized reviewer assignment plans balancing workload, expertise, and timeline adherence.
inputLabel: Upload proposals and reviewer data (JSON or CSV). Include panel timeline details.
outputLabel: Optimized reviewer assignments, workload distribution summary, conflict of interest flags, and timeline adherence alerts.
systemPrompt: You are a secure and privacy-conscious assistant helping academic research grant panel chairs balance reviewer workloads. Accept input data including proposal lists, reviewer profiles, and panel timelines in JSON or CSV format. Validate all inputs rigorously for required fields, types, and logical consistency. Detect potential conflicts of interest but do not make final decisions; only flag them clearly. Generate an optimized assignment plan mapping proposals to reviewers balancing workload fairness, expertise alignment, conflicts, and availability windows. Provide a clear summary of workload distribution and timeline adherence with warnings for bottlenecks or deadline risks. Refuse any requests that attempt to automate final assignment decisions without human oversight, handle confidential data securely, and provide detailed error messages for malformed inputs. Output only plain text summaries or valid JSON when requested. Always require authentication for protected data processing. Do not output any personally identifiable information beyond reviewer names and IDs. Always emphasize that final assignment approval is up to the panel chair.

presets.label: Detect Conflicts of Interest
presets.prompt: Given the uploaded proposals and reviewer profiles, identify and flag all potential conflicts of interest. List conflict flags with proposalId, reviewerId, and flagReason. Do not block assignments; only provide warnings.
presets.hint: Use this preset to generate conflict flags before assignment optimization.

presets.label: Optimize Reviewer Assignments
presets.prompt: Using the proposals, reviewers, conflicts, and panel timeline data, generate an optimized assignment plan that balances workload fairly, aligns expertise, respects reviewer availability, and flags timeline risks. Output assignments with proposalId, reviewerId, and status, plus a workload summary and timeline alerts.
presets.hint: Run this after conflicts have been flagged to get assignment suggestions.

presets.label: Summarize Workload Distribution
presets.prompt: Analyze the current assignments and historical workload data to produce a summary report highlighting workload balance among reviewers, identifying bottlenecks or overloads, and providing timeline adherence forecasts.
presets.hint: Use this to understand workload fairness and deadline risks.

presets.label: Validate Uploaded Data
presets.prompt: Validate the uploaded proposals, reviewers, and timeline data for required fields, correct data types, valid JSON structures, and logical date consistency. Provide detailed error messages for any validation failures.
presets.hint: Run this preset immediately after data upload to catch issues.

jsonSchemaHint: Outputs conform to structured JSON with fields for assignments, workloadSummary, conflictFlags, and validationErrors as applicable.
clarifyPrompt: Please provide the proposals, reviewers, and panel timeline data in JSON or CSV format. Include any historical workload data if available. Specify if you want conflict detection, assignment optimization, or workload summary.
finalizePrompt: Review the generated assignments and conflict flags carefully. Confirm manual overrides or adjustments before finalizing assignment decisions. Use this tool only to assist your workload balancing and not to replace ethical judgment.

idea.workingTitle: Academic Research Grant Reviewer Workload Balancer

niche.role: Academic Research Grant Reviewer Panel Chair
niche.scenario: Assigning and balancing grant proposal review workload among panel reviewers to ensure fair distribution, expertise alignment, and timely completion

idea.problem: Grant panel chairs struggle to assign incoming proposals to reviewers in a way that balances workload fairly, matches expertise accurately, and respects reviewer availability and conflicts of interest, often resulting in uneven review burdens, delays, or compromised review quality.
inputs: List of grant proposals including topic areas and required expertise
Reviewer profiles with expertise tags, declared conflicts of interest, and availability windows
outputs: Optimized reviewer assignment plan mapping proposals to reviewers
Workload distribution summary report highlighting balance and potential bottlenecks
Conflict of interest flags and warnings
Timeline adherence forecast and alerts for review deadlines
Interactive dashboard for manual adjustment and reassignment
whyItWins: Automates complex, multi-constraint assignment tasks that are currently manual or use basic spreadsheets
Improves fairness and transparency of workload distribution, reducing reviewer fatigue and increasing panel morale
Ensures expertise-aligned reviews and flags conflicts early to maintain review integrity
Supports dynamic adjustments as proposals or reviewer availability change
Scales easily from small panels to large, multi-institutional funding bodies

upgradePath.today: Single-page app that accepts proposal and reviewer lists to generate optimized assignments and summary reports for panel chairs
upgradePath.in90Days: Add interactive dashboard for manual tweaking, conflict management, and real-time timeline tracking with email reminders to reviewers
upgradePath.in12Months: Develop full multi-panel management system including reviewer recruitment, historical workload analytics, integration with funder submission portals, and comprehensive reporting for stakeholders

riskNotes: Must carefully handle confidential proposal and reviewer information with secure data management
Avoid automating final assignment decisions without human oversight to prevent unfair outcomes
Should not replace ethical judgment regarding conflicts of interest; only flag them for review
Needs clear user training to interpret optimization suggestions appropriately

blueprint.summary: A workload balancing system for academic research grant review panels that automates and optimizes assignment of proposals to reviewers, ensuring fairness, expertise alignment, conflict management, and timeline adherence, with interactive tools for manual adjustments and reporting.
blueprint.primaryUser: Academic Research Grant Reviewer Panel Chair
successMetrics: Percentage reduction in workload imbalance among reviewers
Number of conflicts of interest flagged and resolved before assignments
Timeliness of review completion relative to deadlines
User satisfaction with assignment suggestions and manual adjustment tools
Adoption rate by panels and scalability to multi-panel management

edgeCases: Reviewer availability changes after assignments are made requiring reassignment.
Conflicts of interest discovered late in the process requiring urgent reassignment.
Incomplete or inconsistent expertise tags leading to suboptimal assignments.
Simultaneous manual adjustments causing assignment conflicts or race conditions.
Data upload errors or malformed input files requiring robust validation and user feedback.
Handling panels with very small numbers of reviewers or proposals limiting optimization options.
Email delivery failures or delays for reminders and alerts.
nonGoals: Automating final assignment decisions without human oversight.
Replacing ethical judgment regarding conflicts of interest.
Managing reviewer recruitment or external funder submission portals in the initial version.
Providing deep AI-based expertise matching beyond tag-based heuristics.
Handling payment or compensation for reviewers.

dataFlow: User logs in via /login page, authenticates via /api/auth/login, receives token.
Panel chair uploads proposals, reviewers, and timeline data on /upload page; data sent to backend for validation and storage in data models.
Conflict detection API (/api/conflicts/check) runs on uploaded data or on-demand to flag potential conflicts; results stored and sent to UI.
Assignment optimization API (/api/assignments/optimize) generates assignment suggestions based on proposals, reviewers, conflicts, and timeline; results returned to UI for review.
Dashboard UI (/dashboard) displays current assignments, conflicts, workload summaries, and timeline alerts; allows manual adjustments.
Manual assignment updates sent to /api/assignments/update, validated, saved, and audit trail updated.
Reports generated on-demand via /api/reports/generate based on panel and date range; report URLs returned for download or viewing.
Background jobs (DeadlineReminderJob and ConflictRecheckJob) run scheduled tasks to send reminders and recheck conflicts, updating data models and notifying users as needed.
validationRules: Authentication required for all pages except /login and corresponding APIs.
Uploaded proposal and reviewer data must conform to schema: required fields present, correct data types, and valid JSON structures for tags and availability.
Panel timeline dates must be valid and logical (startDate < reviewDeadline).
Assignment updates must reference existing proposals and reviewers, and manualOverride flag must be boolean.
Conflict flags must have valid proposalId, reviewerId, non-empty flagReason, and resolved boolean.
API input payloads must be validated for required fields and types before processing.
CSV/JSON uploads must be checked for malformed data, duplicates, and missing required fields with detailed error messages.
Date fields must be ISO 8601 compliant and validated for logical consistency.
Workload summaries must be consistent with assignments and historical workload data.
errorHandling: Return HTTP 401 Unauthorized for unauthenticated access to protected routes and APIs.
Return HTTP 400 Bad Request with detailed validation error messages for malformed or invalid input data.
Gracefully handle missing or inconsistent historical data by logging warnings and proceeding with best-effort assignments.
On assignment optimization failure, return HTTP 500 with error details and fallback to last known good assignments if available.
Conflict detection errors should not block user actions; log errors and notify admins if persistent.
Background job failures (e.g., email delivery) should trigger retry logic with exponential backoff and alert system administrators on repeated failures.
Race conditions in manual assignment updates handled via optimistic concurrency control or transaction retries.
Upload errors must provide user-friendly feedback with line-level or field-level error details.
API responses must include success flags and error messages where applicable to guide UI behavior.
securityNotes: All API routes except /api/auth/login require authentication tokens validated on each request.
Sensitive data fields (e.g., conflictsOfInterest) must be encrypted at rest in the database.
Use HTTPS for all client-server communications to protect data in transit.
Implement role-based access control to restrict data upload, assignment modification, and report generation to panel chairs.
Sanitize and validate all inputs to prevent injection attacks and ensure data integrity.
Audit trails must record user actions on assignments and conflict resolutions for accountability.
Tokens must have expiration and support secure storage on client side (e.g., HttpOnly cookies or secure storage).
Background jobs accessing sensitive data must run in secure environments with limited access.
Log authentication attempts and suspicious activities for monitoring and alerting.

acceptanceTests.given: Proposals, reviewers, and timeline data are present
acceptanceTests.when: The assignment optimization API is called
acceptanceTests.then: Optimized assignments are returned balancing workload, expertise, and conflicts

acceptanceTests.given: Assignments are displayed on the dashboard
acceptanceTests.when: The panel chair manually adjusts an assignment via drag-and-drop
acceptanceTests.then: The update API accepts the change, saves it, and audit trail records the override

acceptanceTests.then: A valid report URL is returned and the report contains accurate workload and timeline data

acceptanceTests.given: An unauthenticated user attempts to access /assignments page
acceptanceTests.then: They are redirected to the login page

acceptanceTests.given: Reviewer availability changes after assignments are made
acceptanceTests.then: Conflicts are rechecked and the panel chair is alerted to reassign affected proposals

acceptanceTests.when: Deadlines approach or workload bottlenecks occur
acceptanceTests.then: Email reminders are sent and failures trigger retries and alerts
